name: ProDevs
short_description: As far as ProDevs knows, tech talent isn't lacking in Africa; the companies who need them just can't see them.

name: Antler
short_description: Antler, a global investment network that focuses on early-stage investments, officially kicked off its latest Lagos cohort on October 20.

name: MyDébboApp
short_description: MyDébboApp is a digital women-centred healthcare platform that uses AI to triage symptoms and guide users to the right care.

name: Alami
short_description: The LaunchPad is Alami Capital’s bid to address the undercapitalisation of women-owned startups in Africa.

name: Approovia
short_description: Approovia is taking on global giants like Microsoft, Oracle, and Salesforce with the launch of its Workspace Manager, a no-code AI platform.

name: DigiTax
short_description: DigiTax, a pan-African e-invoicing firm, has secured technical approval from Nigeria’s Federal Inland Revenue Service (FIRS) to serve as an Access Point Provider and System Integrator.

name: Intron
short_description: Intron, a Nigerian AI company that provides speech-to-text transcription tools for healthcare workers, is expanding beyond the health sector.

name: Releaf
short_description: Conservation and sustainable use of biomass have become a primary global strategy for reducing atmospheric carbon.

name: Marasoft
short_description: Marasoft, the fintech founded by Emmanuel Marakwe-Ogu, denies paying employees with suspected fraudulent funds but fails to share evidence.

name: Tizeti
short_description: Raising capital in naira will help Tizeti avoid the pressure of delivering VC-type returns in a slowing economy.

name: MDaaS
short_description: MDaaS, a startup that operates diagnostic clinics, has launched its first clinic in Cameroon, marking its entry into Francophone Africa.

name: Kuda
short_description: Fintech compliance staff are in hot demand as Nigerian fintechs expand their compliance teams following the Central Bank ban in April.

name: PaidHR
short_description: PaidHR, a Nigerian startup that helps businesses manage their HR functions, is in talks with investors to raise a $1.5 million seed round

name: Okra
short_description: With Nebula, Okra will allow customers to pay cloud costs in local currency, a crucial selling point when companies are reducing USD exposure.

name: Seamfix
short_description: Seamfix, a 17-year-old identity solutions startup, has raised $4.5 million in funding from Alitheia IDF, its first institutional investor.

name: Kuda
short_description: Kuda Bank, Moniepoint, OPay and Palmpay have paused account opening for new customers following a directive from the CBN

name: Flutterwave
short_description: Flutterwave has appointed Dipo Fatokun, a former director at the Central Bank of Nigeria, as its new board chairman.

name: Interswitch
short_description: Interswitch has merged with M-Kudi, a mobile money provider, as it seeks to acquire a payment service bank license from the Central Bank.

name: Interswitch
short_description: Interswitch will venture into Nigeria’s telco sector after acquiring a Tier 5 MVNO license for ₦500 million.

name: Ibrahim
short_description: Ibrahim Ibitade, the CEO of Leatherback, a cross-border payments startup that operates in seven countries, is ready to move from a dramatic episode with

name: Zone
short_description: Zone, Africa’s first licenced blockchain payment infrastructure company, will launch a remittance product in 2025.

name: Chowdeck
short_description: Chowdeck's CEO shares with TechCabal how the YC-backed Nigerian food delivery startup delivered food worth ₦1 billion to its customers in a month.

name: VIBRA
short_description: As VIBRA shut down across it markets in Nigeria, Kenya and Ghana, staff were asked to resign or face termination.

name: Stears
short_description: Stears, a data and intelligence company, is pivoting from consumer-focused data solutions into an organization-focused intelligence company.

name: Paystack
short_description: Online payment giant, Paystack, launches Virtual Terminal, an attempt to expand further into offline payments as Nigeria's POS volume surges.
